jrobots.simulation

Class SimulationController

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • jrobots.simulation.SimulationController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class SimulationController
extends java.lang.Thread
    At this present state, the SimulationController is determined to be the entity which initiates the simulation flow. That is:
    • Initiating Simulation.progress()
    • Receiving feedback from GUI when to do so
    • Loading & Storing SimulationStates in SimulationRun

    • Field Detail

      • controller

        public static SimulationController controller

      • currentState

        public SimulationState currentState

      • simulationIntervalDuration

        public static double simulationIntervalDuration
        How long a simulation step takes for those objects. In [s].
        Important: may not be <= 0 (for the sake of collision reaction calculation in CollisionPanzerPanzer.react)

      • simulationRecalculationInterval

        public static long simulationRecalculationInterval
        How fast the simulation is recalculated in real time. In [ms]. Warning: Don't set this to 0 or the repainting of the GUI will be broken!

        public void run()
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
        Overrides:
        run in class java.lang.Thread

      • setRunning

        public static SimulationController setRunning(boolean running,
                                              SimulationMode simulationMode,
                                              double timeLimit)
        Parameters:
        running -
        • true - SimulationRun is proceeded from the most current SimulationState and will do so until stopped. If there was not already one, a SimulationController is instantiated and set running.
        • false - stops appending SimulationRun with ever new SimulationStates.
        simulationMode - - only relevant if running
        timeLimit - - after how many seconds the simulation is to be stopped automatically
        Returns:
        the new (and already running) SimulationController, if instantiated.
